Table.Description: Determine if loot is a map or magical items.

Table.Name: Critical Hit Results
Table.Description: What happens when a player crits.

Treasure.Name: target disarmed, 1 round to retrieve weapon
target knocked down, opponent has initiative
immediate death, fatal blow (head removed, pierced heart/etc)

Table.Name: Encounter Astral
Table.Description: Encounters in the Astra/ Plane occur on a 1 in 20 chance; check one, two or three times per journey, depending on the party's familiarity with the route followed. * These creatures' perceptions extend into the Astral and Ethereal Planes (as do their magical attack forms), but they do not actually travel therein. Their possible appearance applies only to situations in which the encountering party is near to the Prime Material Plane, and could therefore possibly be affected by the creatures' attack forms.

Table.Name: Encounter Ethereal
Table.Description: Encounters occur on a 1 in 20; if the party is following an unfamiliar "path", check three times total: at the beginning, midpoint, and at the end of the journey. * These creatures' perceptions extend into the Astral and Ethereal Planes (as do their magical attack forms), but they do not actually travel therein. Their possible appearance applies only to situations in which the encountering party is near to the Prime Material Plane, and could therefore possibly be affected by the creatures' attack forms.

Table.Name: Grappling Table
Table.Description: Any hold shown remains in effect from round to round unless the target scores a higher percentage hold. Damage accrues until a hold is broken or until the holder elects to try for a different hold. The target may still inflict damage by lesser hold results shown after the double slashes (//). These might result in both opponents falling to the ground and continuing their grappling there. Note: If the opponent is stunned, a second attack may immediately be made, and the stunned opponent cannot counter for 1 round.

Treasure.Name: waist clinch, opponent may counter; damage:none
arm lock//forearm/elbow smash; damage:1+ strength bonus
headlock//flip or throw; damage:4+ strength bonus
strangle hold//head butt; damage:5+ strength bonus
kick/knee/gouge; damage:8+ strength bonus and target stunned

Table.Name: Insanity Table
Table.Description: *House Table*. If you need to inflict random insanity on a PC/NPC.

Treasure.Name: 2000 gp silver and gold gemmed jewelry
5000 gp gold and coral gemmed jewelry
8000 gp platinum and gold gemmed jewelry

Table.Name: Magic, Deck of Many Things (22 plaque version)
Table.Description: Do you dare draw from the deck? DMG pg. 142

Treasure.Name: Sun, Gain beneficial miscellaneous magic item and 50,000 experience.
Star, Gain 2 points in your primary ability score.
Comet, Defeat the next monster you encounter and increase 1 level.
Throne, Charisma is increased to 18 and you gain a small Keep.
Key, Granted 1 treasure map and 1 magic weapon.
Knight, Granted the services of a 4th level fighter.
The VOID, Soul is trapped immediately, mind is empty. [deck vanishes when this is drawn]
Flames, A Devil immediately takes notice of you and is forever your enemy.
Skull, Battle Death or forever be destroyed!
Talons, Lose all magical items instantly. POOF!
Ruin, Lose all wealth and property immediately.
Euryale, Minus 3 on all petrification saves, permanent.
Rogue, One henchmen turns against you (or old acquaintance)
Balance, Forced alignment change or be judged!
Jester, Gain 10000 experience or 2 more draws from the deck. (only appears once in deck))
Fool, Loose 10000 experience AND draw again from the deck. (only appears once in deck)
Vizier, Know the answer to your next great dilemma.
Idiot, Lose 1d4 intelligence, you can draw again.
Fates, Avoid any situation you choose, one time only.
Donjon, You are magically imprisoned. Lose all gear and items. [deck vanishes when this is drawn]

Table.Name: Magic, Wand of Wonder
Table.Description: What is the current effect of a wand of wonder.

Treasure.Name: slow creature pointed at for 1 turn
deludes wielder for 1 round, believe wand effect of 2nd roll
gust of wind, double force of spell
heavy rain, lasts 1 round in 6'' radius of wielder
summon rhino or elephant or mouse.
stream of 600 butterflies, blinding everyone for 2 rounds
enlarge target if within 6'' of wand
darkness in 3'' diameter at 3'' range from wand
grass grows in area of 16'' square before wand, or 10 times if grass already exists
vanish any non-living object up to 1000 pounds and up to 30 cubic feet in size (object moved to ethereal plane)
invisibility cast on wielder of wand
leaves grow from target if in 6'' of wand
1d4*10 gems of 1gp value shoot forth in a 3'' long stream causing 1hp damage to any creature in path.
shimmering colors dance over a 4'' x 3'' area in front of the wand blinding creatures within for 1d6 rounds.
flesh to stone or reverse if target stoned if target within 6''

Treasure.Name: A bronze telescope, somewhat verdigris stained. Value: 20 gp
A silver hand mirror with a narrow handle and a rose floral pattern. Value: 45 gp
A finely wrought ceramic ewer, forest green in color. Value: 15 gp
A rough cut reddish-brown carnelian, 1" diameter. Value: 40 gp
A gold nugget, roughly the size and shape of a d6, somewhat impure. Value: 15 gp
A pewter goblet with an etching of a knight on a horse. Value: 20 gp
A tarnished golden tiara, the jewels have been pried out. Value: 35 gp
A collapsible 10' pole made of hollow steel of fine craftsmanship. Value: 20 gp
A large silver serving fork. Value: 10 gp
A set of 3 bronze padlocks of diminishing sizes, with matching keys. Value: 8 gp
Pinking shears of fine steel. Value: 5 gp
Beautifully made silver ear spoon. Value: 6 gp
Small metal mirror in a tortoiseshell case. Value: 10 gp
A set of 2-6 small glass rabbit figurines. Value: 1gp each
A 1' tall ceramic beer stein, painted with enamels to celebrate an Autumnal Festival. Value: 25 gp to the right collector
A heart-shaped silver locket, the interior painted with the image of a smiling, red-haired woman. Value: 15 gp
A black leather armband with electrum studs. Value: 6 gp
A silver flute etched with a woodland scene. Value: 10 gp
An ornate candelabra of wrought silver. Value: 40 gp
A set of fine gold spurs. Value: 20 gp
Wooden peg leg inlaid with copper, bottom capped in bronze, and a single cat's eye gem on the frontValue:Pegleg with gem: 35 gp. Gem alone: 25 gp. Pegleg without gem: 5 gp
Ornate smoking pipe complete with finely crafted silver tamp with Ivory handle. Value: 25 gp
Finely carved walking stick of exotic wood with bone and silver inlay and tip. Value: 40 gp
Small looking glass with jeweled handle. Value: 15 gp
Jade, multi-faceted ink pot with decorated silver lid. Value: 20 gp
Small brass tin for snuff, ornately embossed and having tiny emerald decorations. Value: 20 gp
Expertly stuffed and mounted barracuda, on mahogany base with elaborate silver border. Value: 30 gp
Set of intricately hand-painted porcelain Mahjong tiles (incomplete). Value: 15 gp
Amber brooch (amber contains a fossilized crab). Value: 20 gp
Gold plated chamber pot (some discolouration). Value: 5 gp
Gold tooth (sized for an ogre). Value: 15 gp
Dagger with a hematite pommel. Value: 30 gp
Crate holding 200 well-made but unadorned pewter mugs. Value: 1 sp per mug, 10 gp for the full crate
Glass alembic with bronze stand. Value: 15 gp
Quill pen made of a fiery red feather with a gold nib. Value: 12 gp
Large Round shield of wood jacketed in bronze with a lambda on the face. Value: 20 gp
Small, well-made teak box with silver hinges and fittings. Value: 35 gp
Electrum skeleton key (what it goes to unknown). Value: 7 gp
Silver Holy symbol set with a moonstone. Value: 45 gp
Leather dog collar studded with quartz chips. Value: 9 gp
A cork ball covered in a polished leather casing and stitched across the circumference (approximately 3" in diameter). Value: 5 gp
A fine silver urn unadorned, contains the ashes of a male elf. Value: 25 gp
A small brass bell (8 in tall), with religious marking scrawled across its shoulder. Value: 10 gp
A bronze candelabra, already used and covered in melted wax. Value: 20 gp after cleaning it up
A wheel stolen from a ship's helm, 4 ft across and made of stained cherry wood that has cracked with age. Value: 45 gp
A spindle of golden thread. Value: 4 gp
A glittering chunk of rock crystal. Value: 22 gp
A delicate charm bracelet with clover-shaped beads. Value: 10 gp
A large copper bowl rimmed with emerald chips. Value: 40 gp
A gold corkscrew in the shape of a caduceus. Value: 47 gp
An 8x11 badly battered tin folder containing 12 pieces of paper in excellent shape. Value: 6 gp
A small tin (3"x3") containing a wad of 27 tangled up, but still in perfect condition, fish hooks. Value: 13 sp
Engraved brass butt trumpet. Value: 10 gp
Set of 37 tarnished silver napkin rings, engraved with the name "Sir Lord Milfordhausen". Value: 11 gp
A delicate blue-green blown-glass vase. Value: 20 gp
Pocket-sized mahogany statuette of a bald, smiling fat man wearing loose robes. Value: 7 gp
48 feet of Gnomeleaf tapestry. Value: 48 gp

Ceramic wine bottle gilt with silver, studded with tiny semi-precious stones (bloodstone), and a solid-copper stopper with a larger bloodstone set on the top. On the front, near the bottom is a glass insert that allows you to see inside the bottle. Value: Bottle: 25 gp, Stopper: 10 gp
Set of four glass-bottom, pewter mugs. On the glass, on the outside, is a silver inlay of a family crest. Value: Each mug: 10 gp. Set: 45 gp
Gold-tipped peacock-feather quill and carved marble ink bottle with copper stopper. Value: Quill: 10 gp. Ink bottle: 5 gp. Stopper: 2 gp
Ornately carved oak picture frame, small cat's eye gem set in each corner. Frame is 22" x 34". Value: Frame with gems: 45 gp. Frame without gems: 25 gp. Gems: 2.5 gp each
Glass candelabra with copper drip pans. Holds 5 candles in an "x" shaped with one candle in the middle. Value: 50 gp
Gold candle snuffer with silver shaft and leather handle. Value: 40 gp
Toy, 6" long 5" tall working torsion catapult made out of oak. Value: 25 gp. Range: 10
Set of toy marble blocks that create a small 10" tall, 5" diameter circular tower. Value: 10 gp
25 gold coated sling bullets. Value: 1 gp each
Pouch with 50 silver sling bullets, for Werewolves. Value: 6 gp
Small, detailed figurines made of pewter about 2" tall, group of 10. Can be of various monsters, knights, soldiers, etc. Value: 5 gp
Ear Trumpet (Ear Horn, hearing aid) made of silver and minotaur horn. Value: 35 gp
High quality boot polishing and leather care kit. Value: 5 gp
Matching small belt pouches, highly decorated with toggles of ivory. Value: 5 gp each
Eye patch made of black silk with silver wire embroidery and 4 pearls stitched onto area that covers eye. Value: 10 gp
A box of 15 well preserved feathers from exotic birds. Value: 15 gp
A silver ring with a hollowed onyx for carrying poison. Value: 35 gp
A well crafted flashlight that uses a "continual light" stone. It doesn't have the stone. Value: 10 gp
A set of dentist tools, with half of them missing. Value: 25 gp
A glass cookie jar which shocks (no damage) anyone under 16 years who tries to open it. Value: 49 gp
A scale model of a ship (inside it has hidden 100gr of opium, it has to be broken to find them). Value: 10 gp (60 gp
Recipe book of a master chef. Value: 20 gp (40 gp if sold near the castle where he worked
A clever mechanical device which rings a bell if a door isn't opened in the proper way. Value: 10 gp
A waterproof scroll case. Value: 30 gp
A small (and broken) model of an unknown fire spitting machine. A master ingenieur might make something out of it
A table for figuring out logarithms, trigonometric variables and other mathematical operations. Value: 5 gp
A sturdy and reliable hand drill. Value: 10 gp
1 of a pair parabolic dishes which, if set one in front of the other, allow for sound to travel way farther than normally possible. Value: 25 gp
An Orcish to Common dictionary. Value: 7 gp
Two finely crafted metal bookends, one depicting the front half of a beautiful mermaid, the other depicting the back half. Value: 27 gp
An ornamental gilded boat anchor, etched with a map of the Savage Coast. Value: 30 gp
A small banded treasure box inlaid with gold filigree. When opened is filled with fine white talcum powder and a powder puff. Value: 7 gp for the powder; 49 gp for the box
An wax seal kit consisting of a brass stamp with a blue glass handle and 18 wax sticks (6 each of red, black, and white). The seal itself depicts a badger head encircled by an ouroboros. Value: 10 gp
Chess set with ivory & ebony pieces and inlaid marble board. Value: 25 gp
Horseshoe, embellished with gold, silver and small diamond inlay set upon finely made exotic wood stand, as trophy. Value: 35 gp
Back-scratcher crafted from Ivory and Bone, decorated with scrimshaw and small rubies set to resemble fingernails in the hand. Value: 30 gp
Set of 5 silk handkerchiefs. Value: 12 gp
Perfectly round stone paperweight, made of onyx, with carved eye and a perfect garnet set as pupil. Value: 25 gp
Highly detailed painting of (pick your color) Dragon, using its breath weapon, in gilded frame. Value: 50 gp

Set of multifaceted dice, crafted of various colors of semi-precious stone complete with numbers marked on their faces. Stored in blue felt pouch, embroidered with the initials 'CR' in gold thread. Value: 10 gp
Small mallet with smooth onyx handle and lapis head. Value: 35 gp
Poorly written tome on the nature and interaction of satyrs and nymphs (with many pictures). Value: 15 gp
A small box with 10 golden roses.. Value: 2 gp per rose, 30 gp for all of them

slip down and grab leg; none
target knocked to hands and knees; 3+strength bonus

Table.Name: Potion Miscibility Table
Table.Description: What happens when you experiment with multiple potions.

Treasure.Name: BOOM! Internal damage is 6d10 hp, those within 5`` radius take 1d10 hp. If mixed externally all in 10' radius take 4d4 damage with no save.
Lethal poison results and imbiber is dead. If externally mixed, a gas cloud of 10' diameter forms and all within must save versus poison or die.
Mild poison causes nausea and loss of 1 point of strength and dexterity for 5d4 rounds with no save. One potion is cancelled and the other is at half strength.
Immiscible, both potions totally destroyed as they cancel each other.
Immiscible, one potion is cancelled but the other remains.
Immiscible result which causes both potions to be at 1/2 normal efficiency when consumed.
Miscible, potions work normally unless effect are contradictory.
Compatible result, causes one potion to have 150% efficiency.
EUREKA! The mixture has created a special formula which will cause one of the two potions effects to become permanent upon the imbiber.

Boat anchor with ten foot long rusted chain attached
A low-crush hat of black velvet with a scarlet feather
A large (ostrich sized) black speckled egg. (It was stolen from an axe-beak nest nearby in the wilderness, they are angry
An open barrel with the shafts of five spears still rising from it (a close inspection of the spears reveals them to be battle worthy, but not especially valuable

A small cairn, some six feet long by three feet wide by three feet high constructed of fist to head sized stones and broken chunks of masonry (characters excavating it can find the skeletal remains of a woman in rusted and worthless chainmail armor
A brass lantern hanging from a wall hook (wick missing, no oil
A pitch coated two gallon leather bucket half-full of oily water

A huge, misshapen pile of vines, stems, and rotting foliage lying on the floor (if characters have encountered a shambling mound before, they will recognize the pile as the remains of one of those strange creatures
A crate of axe heads (for battle axes) but no shafts
Four plates and four goblets made out of stone with matching knife, fork, and spoon sets. Silverware is metal with stone handles
A small burlap sack that contains approximately 300 seeds. (If planted they turn out to be turnip seeds
Five six foot lengths of wood. A Ranger or Elf may recognize these as cut Yew saplings that could be made into excellent long bows by a trained bowyer
A clay bust of a Medusa head
A tun of fortified, very potent red wine
A small wooden box containing 150 butterfly wings
A pedestal holding a half carved marble bust, debitage lies on the floor all around
Two bull horns, each broken off about a foot down
A small cask of very strong grain alcohol (characters drinking it must save vs. poison or be blinded
A jar of green paste, which if rubbed on the skin proves extremely repellant to aaracokra
A small pouch of powdered sandstone
A large and very fragile glass water clock, possibly worth 30-50gp
A battered keg containing old, cheap, and mostly-spoiled wine. It's maybe half vinegar, mildly eye & skin irritant, and quite vile

A broken stick, maybe four foot long and dark brown. Close examination by an archer reveals it is (was) a composite short bow...examination by a fletcher reveals it was built for 16 strength. Close examination of the area shows a large bloodstain on the floor where it is found
A practice dummy, on its side with most of the covering torn off & the pedestal broken
A pile of boxes, all stenciled "CANDLES, FOUR DOZEN". All are empty, half are rotted enough to be useless

A latched (not locked) wooden box containing large mallet, a couple of metal bars, a couple of odd-looking spikes, and a straight stick with measurements marked on it. Any stonemason can immediately identify it as the tools of his trade. Dwarves, Gnomes, or Drow elves can do the same with an intelligence check on a 1d20
A hand carved limestone mold for making bronze axe heads. Molten bronze is poured into it and after cooling, the two halves are separated, leaving a rough bronze axe head
A small wooden box holding six different sticks of colored chalk. The white and yellow are nearly all used up, only nubs remain
A bent and rusty trap for small animals. Two feet of rusty chain is attached to one end
A pile of corks from wine bottles (2d10), most are starting to disintegrate
A broken clay pipe, the bowl is intact but the stem is in small pieces
A box containing a wooden rolling pin, half a dozen tin cookie cutters in campaign-appropriate holiday shapes and a thin volume of cookie recipes

A 5-inch thick tome with the words "DON'T PANIC" written in large, friendly letters on the cover. The pages have been eaten through by bookworms and are illegible. (alternate item: A large, threadbare towel, approximately 3'x5', very stained
Large glass jar of dill pickles and a pair of metal tongs
Collapsible camp seat. Leather seat needs repair but otherwise usable
A small bag containing 72 mice skulls
A half-eaten sausage covered in fuzzy mold
A ceramic jar filled with 63 pickled eggs (and the pickling brine)
A fingerless four-fingered leather glove, left handed

A pouch containing 181 pieces of shredded parchment. If pieced together (a task that might take many hours), the PC will be able to read the following message "Thanks for the lovely time last fortnight. Derf and I and I enjoyed our visit very much
A small box of bat dung
A long white sheet with two eyeholes cut out
A 3' diameter hoop fashioned from twisted copper wire
Rusted iron lock - still functions but there is no key
Slender glass box (3x9x13 inches) filled with sand and stinging ants
The right-hand pinky knucklebone of one of the party member's mother
A child's drawing of a lich, rendered on birch bark with charcoal
A small iron cross which smells strongly of mint
A simple iron helm, caved in on the left side
A set of seven six-sided gambling dice made of bugbear shinbone. One of them rolls true. Usually at an inopportune moment
42 pairs of women's woolen socks, size small
An iron ankle bracelet emblazoned with the sigil of a local deity
13 goblin ears on a wire chain
A round, palm-sized, chalky-black stone that weighs approximately 2 pounds
A ceramic pot of goat urine, sealed with wax
An extravagantly-painted deck of tarot cards
A tattered page, obviously torn from a book, which contains a recipe for a delectable onion soup
A fist-sized hair ball coughed up by a manticore
A sprig of elderberry wrapped in white linen
A battered lantern missing two panes
A complex puzzle box (can only be opened by a person with intelligence and dexterity of 14 or greater... or a strength of 12+, but destroying the box
An artist's palette with the pigments all dried up (they could possibly be restored with water
Half of a torn treasure map depicting an unfamiliar coastline, the "X" indicating where to dig is on the missing piece
A lacquered paper parasol with a fanciful flower pattern
A holy symbol of a good aligned deity
A scroll case with a quill, small bottle of ink, and couple parchments
A Deck of Not A Lot of Things, scorched and burned beyond readability
An empty scabbard decorated with gems made of paste. The scabbard is engraved "Property of Arthur

Table.Name: Shields and Armor I
Table.Description: Shields and Armor magic items one.

Table.Name: Shields and Armor Selection Table
Table.Description: Select one of the shields and armor tables.

Table.Name: Spells, Confusion Effects
Table.Description: This is what happens each round when someone is confused.

Treasure.Name: Attack source of confusion or it's party for 1 round

Table.Name: Spells, Magic-User Reincarnation Effect
Table.Description: The new incarnation will retain the original character’s experience points, but will have new physical (Str, Dex, Con) ability scores randomly rolled and adjusted for the new race. The character will retain his or her original mental ability scores (Int, Wis, Cha).

Table.Name: Spells, Monster Summon I
Table.Description: Spells, Monster Summon I. Summons 2d4 creatures in 1d3 rounds. duration: 2 rounds + 1 round/ level. Evil casters may get the monsters in parentheses, at the DM’s option.

Table.Name: Spells, Monster Summon II
Table.Description: Spells, Monster Summon II. Summons 1d6 creatures in 1d3 rounds. duration: 3 rounds + 1 round/ level

Table.Name: Spells, Summon Monster III
Table.Description: Spells, Summon Monster III. Summons 1d4 creatures in 1d3 rounds. duration: 4 rounds + 1 round/ level

Table.Name: Spells, Summon Monster IV
Table.Description: Spells, Summon Monster IV. Summons 1d4 creatures in 1d3 rounds. duration: 5 rounds + 1/ level

Table.Name: Spells, Summon Monster V
Table.Description: Spells, Summon Monster V. Summons 1d2 creatures in 1d3 rounds. duration: 6 rounds + 1 round/ level

Table.Name: Spells, Summon Monster VI
Table.Description: Spells, Summon Monster VI. Summons 1d2 creatures in 1d3 rounds. duration: 7 rounds + 1 round/ level

Table.Name: Spells, Summon Monster VII
Table.Description: Spells, Summon Monster VII. Summons 1d2 creatures in 1 round. duration: 8 rounds + 1 round/ level

Table.Name: Sword Selection Table
Table.Description: Sword selection of Sword I or Sword II

Table.Name: Sword, Dragon Slayer
Table.Description: What type of dragon is the sword do triple damage against?

Treasure.Name: charm person on contact 3 times a day
determine directions and depth 2 times a day
levitation as 6th level, 1 turn, 3 times a day
strength 1 time a day, wielder only
telekinesis 2500 gp weight max, 2 times a day
teleportation 1 time a day 6000 gp weight max
X-ray vision 4'' range 2 times a day, 1 turn per use
character may choose 1 power from Sword Extraordinary powers, DMG p167

Table.Name: Sword, Unusual Sword Languages
Table.Description: Languages spoken by swords with a special purpose

Treasure.Name: detect traps of large size in 1'' radius
detect precious metals, type and amount in 2'' radius
detect gems, kind and number in 1/2'' radius
getting extraordinary power instead...*this not seen*

Table.Name: Sword, Unusual Sword Purpose Power
Table.Description: Power triggered when sword is performing it's special purpose.

Treasure.Name: +2 on all saves, -1 on each die of damage taken

Table.Name: Sword, Unusual Swords
Table.Description: Check to see if the weapon has an unsual set of powers.

Treasure.Name: (2 primary abilities, empathy){ref:Sword, Unusual Sword Primary Abilities:0:0:1}
(2 primary abilities, speech){ref:Sword, Unusual Sword Primary Abilities:0:0:1}
(3 primary abilities, speech){ref:Sword, Unusual Sword Primary Abilities:0:0:2}
(3 primary abilities, speech/read){ref:Sword, Unusual Sword Primary Abilities:0:0:2}
(3 primary abilities,1 extraordinary, speech, telepathy, read magical-writings){ref:Sword, Unusual Sword Primary Abilities:0:0:2}{ref:Sword, Unusual Sword Extraordinary Power:0:0:1}
Sword +1, +2 vs magic-user and enchanted creatures
Sword +1, Flame Tongue, +2 vs regenerating, +3 vs cold-using or avian, +4 vs undead
Sword +3, Frost Brand, +6 vs fire using creatures
Wand of Metal and Mineral Detection
Wand of Secret Door and Trap Location
Dagger +1, +2 vs creature smaller than man-sized
Dagger +2, +3 vs creatures larger than man-sized
